categories.name: Water Quality
categories.description: There are {count} contaminants which filtration concentrations do not meet the [World Health Organization's tap water quality standards](https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/9789241549950).
categories.descriptionFr: Il y a {count} contaminants dont les concentrations de filtration ne respectent pas les [normes de qualité de l'eau potable de l'Organisation mondiale de la santé](https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/9789241549950).

categories.name: Air Quality
categories.description: Air pollution data for your area, including [radon levels](https://www.epa.gov/radon) and other airborne contaminants.
categories.descriptionFr: Données sur la pollution de l'air pour votre région, y compris les [niveaux de radon](https://www.epa.gov/radon) et autres contaminants atmosphériques.

categories.name: Health
categories.description: Pathogen and disease risk information for your area. See [CDC Disease Information](https://www.cdc.gov/) for more details.
categories.descriptionFr: Informations sur les risques de pathogènes et de maladies pour votre région. Consultez les [informations sur les maladies du CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/) pour plus de détails.

categories.name: Disaster Risk
categories.description: Natural disaster risk assessment for your area. Visit [FEMA](https://www.fema.gov/) for emergency preparedness resources.
categories.descriptionFr: Évaluation des risques de catastrophes naturelles pour votre région. Visitez [FEMA](https://www.fema.gov/) pour les ressources de préparation aux urgences.

subCategories.name: Fertilizers
subCategories.description: Nitrates and phosphates from agricultural runoff that can contaminate water supplies.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Nitrates et phosphates provenant du ruissellement agricole qui peuvent contaminer les approvisionnements en eau.

subCategories.name: Pesticides
subCategories.description: Chemical pesticides including herbicides, insecticides, and fungicides that may contaminate water sources.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Pesticides chimiques, y compris les herbicides, insecticides et fongicides qui peuvent contaminer les sources d'eau.

subCategories.name: Radioactive
subCategories.description: Radioactive elements such as uranium, radium, and radon that can occur naturally or from industrial sources.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Éléments radioactifs tels que l'uranium, le radium et le radon qui peuvent provenir de sources naturelles ou industrielles.

subCategories.name: Disinfection Byproducts
subCategories.description: Chemical byproducts formed when disinfectants like chlorine react with organic matter in water.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Sous-produits chimiques formés lorsque les désinfectants comme le chlore réagissent avec la matière organique dans l'eau.

subCategories.name: Heavy Metals & Inorganics
subCategories.description: Heavy metals like lead, arsenic, and mercury, as well as other inorganic compounds.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Métaux lourds comme le plomb, l'arsenic et le mercure, ainsi que d'autres composés inorganiques.

subCategories.name: Organic Compounds
subCategories.description: Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and other organic chemicals that can contaminate water.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Composés organiques volatils (COV) et autres produits chimiques organiques qui peuvent contaminer l'eau.

subCategories.name: Microbiological
subCategories.description: Bacteria, viruses, and other microorganisms that can contaminate water supplies.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Bactéries, virus et autres micro-organismes qui peuvent contaminer les approvisionnements en eau.

subCategories.name: Radon
subCategories.description: Radon is a naturally occurring radioactive air pollutant responsible for approximately [21,000 lung cancer deaths per year](https://www.epa.gov/radon/health-risk-radon) in the United States.
subCategories.descriptionFr: Le radon est un polluant atmosphérique radioactif naturel responsable d'environ [21 000 décès par cancer du poumon par an](https://www.epa.gov/radon/health-risk-radon) aux États-Unis.

subCategories.name: Lyme Disease
subCategories.description: [Lyme disease](https://www.cdc.gov/lyme/) is caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi and is transmitted to humans through the bite of infected blacklegged ticks.
subCategories.descriptionFr: La [maladie de Lyme](https://www.cdc.gov/lyme/) est causée par la bactérie Borrelia burgdorferi et est transmise aux humains par la piqûre de tiques à pattes noires infectées.
